name: Rahima Foundation
mission: Rahima International Foundation strives to feed the hungry, assist the financially insecure, and support students in their educational journey.
theoryOfChange: Rahima Foundation states it provides a safety net to low-income community members through monthly groceries, rent and utility assistance, hot meals, and educational support to address basic needs and food insecurity.
zakatClaimEvidence: Found 'donate zakat' on https://www.rahima.org/zakat-rahima (https://www.rahima.org/zakat-rahima); Website mission/programs mention zakat

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or regions with limited nonprofit coverage
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 37/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years
components.name: Evidence & Outcomes

judge_issues.message: The impact rationale mentions a high cost per beneficiary of 14222.072, but this is not reflected in the 'Cost Per Beneficiary' component of the score details, which states it is average for HUMANITARIAN. The rationale should clarify why this average cost still results in a lower impact score.
The rationale does not explicitly mention the risk deductions applied due to the small board size, which is a key factor in the overall score.
Evaluation source domain 'projects.propublica.org' is not a known trusted evaluator
Zakat acceptance claimed but no evidence, URL, or direct verification provided

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Board too small: 2 members

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: RAHIMA INTERNATIONAL FOUNDATION earns 50/100 due to strong alignment and limited impact, with zakat compliance (significant risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Found 'donate zakat' on https://www.rahima.org/zakat-rahima (https://www.rahima.org/zakat-rahima); Website mission/programs mention zakat

all_citations.claim: Rahima International Foundation holds a Charity Navigator score of 96.0/100 and maintains a program expense ratio of 95.3%.
The organization reported total revenue of $4,006,022 and holds 65.0 months of working capital.
The charity is Zakat-eligible and provides various donation options for humanitarian relief.
The foundation offers volunteer opportunities to engage the community in its mission.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a moderate overall score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and high donor alignment, though its impact score is tempered by a high cost per beneficiary and the need for more direct evidence of long-term effectiveness.
areas_for_improvement: Enhance public reporting on specific long-term educational outcomes for supported students.
Increase third-party impact verification to improve the overall data confidence and impact score.

dimension_explanations.alignment: With an alignment score of 37/50, the charity shows high donor fit for those seeking to support humanitarian causes and Zakat-eligible initiatives [3]. The foundation also encourages community engagement through various volunteer opportunities, strengthening its local track record [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates strong financial health with a Charity Navigator score of 96.0/100 and a total revenue of $4,006,022 [1][2]. While it maintains a high program expense ratio of 95.3%, the impact score of 19/50 reflects a relatively high cost per beneficiary of 14222.072 and a need for more comprehensive evidence of program outcomes [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: Rahima International Foundation is a high-impact humanitarian organization dedicated to alleviating hunger and supporting educational advancement for the financially insecure.
strengths: Exceptional program expense ratio of 95.3%, ensuring the vast majority of funds directly reach those in need.
Highly efficient fundraising operations with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised.
Robust financial stability with 65.0 months of working capital available.
baseline_narrative.summary: Based in California, Rahima International Foundation operates critical community programs including food distribution, soup kitchens, and meat collection to combat local food insecurity [1][2]. The organization is recognized as Zakat-eligible, providing a verified channel for donors to fulfill their religious obligations through direct humanitarian aid [3].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The foundation earns a moderate overall score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and high donor alignment, though its impact score is tempered by a high cost per beneficiary and the need for more direct evidence of long-term effectiveness.

areas_for_improvement.context: The current <cite id="12">board consists of only 2 members</cite>, which falls below the recommended threshold for diverse independent oversight.
While direct services are clear, the organization's <cite id="13">evidence and outcomes are currently unverified</cite> by third-party evaluators.

bbb_assessment.summary: The organization maintains high transparency and accountability standards consistent with major charity watchdogs.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization's 30-year track record and high transparency seal mitigate some governance concerns.
risk_factors: <cite id="12">Board size of 2 members</cite> creates governance risk
<cite id="10">Excessive working capital</cite> suggests funds could be deployed more aggressively
case_against.summary: The primary concerns involve governance risks and excessive capital retention: <cite id="12">the board is too small</cite> and the organization holds <cite id="10">over 5 years of cash reserves</cite>.

confidence.notes: Strong financial data but governance structure is a noted risk.

alignment.explanation: The charity is a strong fit for Muslim donors as it is <cite id="6">verified Zakat-eligible</cite> and serves the <cite id="16">fuqara (poor) and masakin (needy)</cite>.
alignment.improvement: The foundation could <cite id="17">expand services to more underserved regions</cite> beyond its current Northern California focus.

credibility.explanation: Donors can trust the organization's financial integrity due to its <cite id="4">96.0/100 from Charity Navigator score</cite> and <cite id="14">95.3% independent board members</cite>.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the foundation should <cite id="12">expand its board of directors</cite> to include more members to ensure robust governance.

impact.explanation: Operations are highly efficient with a <cite id="3">100.0% program ratio</cite>, though the <cite id="15">cost per beneficiary is high at $14,222</cite>.
impact.improvement: Impact measurement would benefit from <cite id="13">seeking external evaluation</cite> to validate long-term outcomes for students and food recipients.

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Theory of change is clear but outcomes are unverified

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Provides large-scale grants to established international relief agencies

rich_narrative.headline: Rahima International Foundation is a high-impact humanitarian organization dedicated to alleviating hunger and supporting educational advancement for the financially insecure.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who prioritize local Bay Area humanitarian impact and want to fulfill Zakat through an organization with zero fundraising overhead.
donor_motivations: Want to ensure 95.3% of their donation reaches program services
Value Zakat-eligibility for local hunger relief
Look for high financial accountability ratings
giving_considerations: The organization holds very high reserves, meaning your gift adds to a large endowment
Governance is concentrated in a very small board
Impact is focused on direct aid rather than systemic advocacy
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking a charity with a large, diverse board of directors or those looking for rigorous academic impact evaluations.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects a clear theory of change and direct service model, but a lack of <cite id="13">third-party verified outcome data</cite>.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: By providing immediate food assistance and educational support, the foundation aims to stabilize financially insecure households and empower the next generation.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that direct aid effectively transitions beneficiaries out of poverty rather than just providing temporary relief.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: While the organization has high reserves, its <cite id="18">revenue has declined by -5.2%</cite> over three years, suggesting a need for stable donor support.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by a <cite id="3">95.3% program expense ratio</cite> compared to a <cite id="9">peer median of 89.7%</cite>.

similar_organizations.differentiator: Similar focus on humanitarian aid for children
similar_organizations.name: KinderUSA

strengths.detail: The organization directs <cite id="3">95.3% of its expenses to programs</cite>, significantly exceeding the <cite id="9">industry standard of 75%</cite>.
Rahima holds a <cite id="4">96/100 rating from Charity Navigator</cite> and a Gold Seal of Transparency from Candid.
The foundation maintains <cite id="10">65.0 months of working capital</cite>, providing immense long-term financial security.

strengths_deep_dive: Rahima International Foundation demonstrates a remarkable commitment to low-overhead operations, evidenced by its <cite id="7">fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised</cite>. This efficiency is supported by a strong volunteer base and a focus on direct service delivery. Furthermore, the organization is a significant community funder, having provided a <cite id="11">$1,000,000 grant to USA FOR UNHCR</cite> to support international relief efforts, showcasing its ability to manage large-scale philanthropic distributions alongside its local programs.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 1993, Rahima International Foundation is a California-based humanitarian organization that has spent over <cite id="1">three decades addressing food insecurity</cite> and poverty within the San Francisco Bay Area. The organization operates a robust suite of direct-service programs, including <cite id="2">food distribution, soup kitchens, and meat collection</cite> to support the financially insecure. Rahima is distinguished by its exceptional financial efficiency, reporting a <cite id="3">95.3% program expense ratio</cite> in its most recent filings, ensuring that every dollar contributed is directed toward its core mission. The charity maintains a <cite id="4">96/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting high standards of accountability and transparency. Beyond immediate hunger relief, the foundation <cite id="5">supports students in their educational journey</cite>, providing a holistic approach to poverty alleviation. As a <cite id="6">Zakat-eligible organization</cite>, it serves as a trusted vehicle for Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations through localized humanitarian impact. Despite its long history, the organization maintains a lean operational model with <cite id="7">$0.00 spent to raise every $1</cite>, a rare benchmark in the nonprofit sector. Its geographic reach spans several Northern California counties, including <cite id="8">Alameda, Santa Clara, and San Francisco</cite>, where it bridges critical gaps in the local social safety net.
